title.rendered: Applicature Announces Matthew Thomas as Business Development Director in L.A.

content.rendered:
Matthew Thomas represents the Applicature blockchain development agency in the City of Los Angeles

Los Angeles, California, February 2018 – Applicature is pleased to introduce Matthew Thomas, who recently joined the company in the capacity of Business Development Director. He will be responsible for developing new business opportunities in the area and creating solutions for customers who want to rely on blockchain technology to develop Initial Coin Offerings and smart contracts.

Matthew’s outstanding industry knowledge will help Applicature’s team to increase brand awareness and drive the company’s growth plans by helping businesses select and deploy the right blockchain technology for their business cases while developing applications based on blockchain.

“I’m an avid cryptocurrency trader and blockchain enthusiast who believes these emerging technologies will revolutionize the world,” says Matthew.

Prior to joining Applicature, Matthew Thomas consulted for several blockchain projects, providing ICO white paper reviews, token creation сomponents, and roadmaps. Much of Matthew’s early career was spent in the greater Chicago area, where he held roles in sales and product management.

In addition, he founded a startup called the Bond Shop Club, an omnichannel platform dedicated to strengthening the relationship between high-end consumers and luxury retailers by offering incentives solely redeemable at brick-and-mortar locations.

Matthew Thomas is a Michigan State University graduate who practiced with the MSU basketball practice team under legendary coach Tom Izzo. He is currently enrolled in the Pepperdine University Graziadio School of Business and Management in pursuit of his MBA.

Blockchain enthusiasts are welcome to follow Matthew’s LinkedIn profile to remain aware of technology innovations.

Please join us in welcoming Matthew!
